text: The President of the United Arab Emirates is the head of state of the United Arab Emirates. Officially, he is elected every five years by the Federal Supreme Council, but because the emir (leader) of Abu Dhabi customarily also holds the presidency of the UAE, the office is de facto hereditary. The President is also Supreme Commander of the UAE Armed Forces and Chairman of the Supreme Council and Supreme Petroleum Council. == Emir of Dubai == No Name Term of office 1 Sheikh `Ubayd bin Said ... 1833 2 Sheikh Maktoum I bin Bati bin Suhayl 1833 1852 3 Sheikh Said I bin Bati 1852 1859 4 Sheikh Hushur bin Maktoum 1859 1886 5 Sheikh Rashid I bin Maktoum 1886 1894 6 Sheikh Maktoum II bin Hushur 1894 1906 7 Sheikh Bati bin Suhayl 1906 1912 8 Sheikh Saeed II bin Maktoum 1912 1929 9 Sheikh Mani bin Rashid 1929 1929 10 Sheikh Saeed II bin Maktoum 1929 1958 11 Sheikh Rashid II bin Said Al Maktoum 1958 2 December 1971 ==Presidents of the United Arab Emirates (1971–present)== Portrait Name (Birth–Death) Term of office 1 Sheikh Dhiyab bin Isa Al Nahyan 1761–1793 2 Sheikh Shakhbut bin
